sentences: Motohiko "Toko" Hino (January 3, 1946 in Tokyo â€“ May 13, 1999) was a Japanese jazz drummer.
In the mid-1970s, Hino was repeatedly voted by Swing Journal as the best jazz drummer in Japan, though from 1978 he was based in New York City.

He released an album under his own name in 1971 and two more in the early 1990s, and played with musicians such as JoAnne Brackeen, Joe Henderson, Takehiro Honda, Nobuyoshi Ino, Karen Mantler, Hugh Masekela, John Scofield, Jean-Luc Ponty, Sonny Rollins, and Shungo Sawada.
It's There (Fun House, 1993)With Jon Faddis and Billy Harper
